focus: Folios with highest unknown counts (q01 Herbal A primarily)

proposals.description: sh- location prefix + e element, demonstrative pronoun; appears near shy (hic), shol (locus)
proposals.reasoning: Strongly associated with sh- location words (shy, sho, shol). Pattern matches demonstrative function. Neighbors include shol (4x), kodshey (4x), sheaiin (4x).

proposals.description: che- botanical variation + ol location; leaf variation, strongly associated with chol (plant part)
proposals.reasoning: Very strongly associated with chol (15x neighbor). Similar to cheor (variat), cheod (pars variat). All che- words relate to botanical variation/elements.

proposals.description: ct- touch prefix + ho action; touches/makes contact, appears in descriptive passages
proposals.reasoning: Similar to cho (facit) but with 't' insertion. Neighbors include daiin (9x), sho (4x), shy (3x). Pattern suggests contact/touching action.

proposals.description: ch- botanical + an suffix; plant/herbal reference in formulaic contexts
proposals.reasoning: Appears in formulaic contexts with dor (6x), otchor (4x), daiin (4x). ch- prefix (botanical) confirmed. Similar to chai (alius).

recommendation: Add Tier 1 words (she, cheol) immediately - 22 occurrences, high confidence. Review Tier 2 (ctho, chan) with human validation - 25 occurrences, moderate confidence.
